title: 103_hr945
content: The "Primary Health Care Investment Act of 1993" may be cited as the short title for this Act. It includes provisions related to public health service primary care. The "Primary Health Care Investment Act of 1993" includes amendments to funding for Migrant Health Centers, Community Health Centers, and National Health Service Corps Scholarship and Loan Repayment Programs for fiscal years 1994 to 1998. The Primary Health Care Investment Act of 1993 amends funding for various health programs for fiscal years 1994 to 1998, including increases in funding for Programs and Health Services for the Homeless. SEC. 3. Payments for direct graduate medical education costs of primary care residents increased. The amendment to Section 1886(h) of the Social Security Act increases payments for direct graduate medical education costs of primary care residents by determining approved FTE resident amounts for each cost reporting period. The national average salary per FTE resident in fiscal year 1989 is used as a basis for calculation. The Secretary updates the amount determined for each cost reporting period based on the estimated percentage change in the consumer price index from the midpoint of the preceding period to the midpoint of the subsequent period, with adjustments for previous under- or over-estimations. The Secretary updates the amount determined for each cost reporting period based on the estimated percentage change in the consumer price index. In paragraph (3)(B)(i), the term "hospital's" is struck, and in paragraph (4), the rules for calculating the number of full-time-equivalent residents in an approved residency program are amended. Weighting factors are specified for different types of residents. The weighting factor for a nonprimary care resident not in their initial residency period is 1.2. Adjustments will be made to maintain payments to hospitals at the same level as before the amendments. Effective date is for cost reporting periods after October 1, 1993. For cost reporting periods after October 1, 1993, section 1886(h) provisions from before this Act will apply proportionally to the period before fiscal year 1994.
